node.name: APS Plug-in
node.shortdescription:
APS plug-in for Eclipse is a tool for software vendors to package SaaS/cloud applications with Application Packaging Standard (APS). The plug-in provides handy and friendly interface to reflect application objects in standard metadata, ensuring their integrity. APS versions 1.x are supported.

The APS plug-in for Eclipse allows:

* Building APS package
* Validating APS package
* Creating project from existing APS package
* Deploying APS package to APS-compliant control panels

* Editing APS metadata
* APS metadata localization
* Inserting APS environment variables while editing scripts

* Managing package files and folders
* Linking APS project to external application sources
* Modifying files and folders from an external application sources

New in version 1.4:

* Deploying APS package to Parallels Operations Automation
* Publication of APS package
* APS package signing
* Quick Fix for missed metadata
* Tips for APS Metadata File Editor
* Support of Unix archives for external application sources

See more details at http://www.apsstandard.org/isv/documentation/.
node.body:
APS plug-in for Eclipse is a tool for software vendors to package SaaS/cloud applications with Application Packaging Standard (APS). The plug-in provides handy and friendly interface to reflect application objects in standard metadata, ensuring their integrity. APS versions 1.x are supported.

The APS plug-in for Eclipse allows:

* Building APS package
* Validating APS package
* Creating project from existing APS package
* Deploying APS package to APS-compliant control panels

* Editing APS metadata
* APS metadata localization
* Inserting APS environment variables while editing scripts

* Managing package files and folders
* Linking APS project to external application sources
* Modifying files and folders from an external application sources

New in version 1.4:

* Deploying APS package to Parallels Operations Automation
* Publication of APS package
* APS package signing
* Quick Fix for missed metadata
* Tips for APS Metadata File Editor
* Support of Unix archives for external application sources

See more details at http://www.apsstandard.org/isv/documentation/.
